data.title: Dive into anything
data.text:
Hello, Здравствуйте,

I am a Canadian who has been in love with the Russian culture, history and language since I was 10 years old. As of April 2023 I started learning the language and have a strong urge to visit. I can hold a very basic conversation, but my reading is pretty good.

I am planning on flying into DME, then proceeding to Moscow, St. Petersburg, the Golden Ring, maybe Lake Baikal and Novosibirsk.

I have the flight figured out, but not booked yet. I wanted to run it by reddit first.

So I guess my questions would be,

Is it really that much of a risk to visit now? (I am not worried but everyone I talk to says I am crazy.)

Should I rent a car or just use the metro system? If suggested to use the metro, is the metro hard to navigate?

For accommodation, what are some good/trustworthy websites to book through?

As a tourist do I have to check in at the nearest police station each time I enter a new city?

Is it hard to get train tickets to other cities?

Is $900 USD good for 18 days?

Any tips or recommendations? (Travelling tips, Sites, What not to do/to do etc.)

Thank you in advance! Большое спасибо!

Update:

Thank you for all the feedback. Everyone was very helpful.

I have changed my itinerary to just Moscow, St. Petersburg and Vladimir. Maybe Kazan if i have extra time. I have tripled my budget so now it should be more than enough. Thank you, I am so excited to see your beautiful country and culture. If anyone is in the cities I mentioned and wants to be friends DM me!
